input_id.description: The ID of the sample being processed. This vector should have the same length as the `--input_r1` argument.

input_r1.description: Paths to the sequences to be mapped. If using Illumina paired-end reads, only the R1 files should be passed.

input_r2.description: Paths to the sequences to be mapped. If using Illumina paired-end reads, only the R2 files should be passed.

reference_index.description: Path to the reference built by star_build_reference. Corresponds to the --genomeDir argument in the STAR command.

reference_gtf.description: Path to the gtf reference file.

output.description: Path to output directory. Corresponds to the --outFileNamePrefix argument in the STAR command.

run_htseq_count.description: Whether or not to also run htseq-count after STAR.

run_multiqc.description: Whether or not to also run MultiQC at the end.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

param_list.description: Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
param_list.help_text:
Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
A csv should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline.
A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline.
A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a parameter.
Inside the Nextflow pipeline code, params.params_list can also be used to directly a list of parameter sets.
When passing a csv, json or yaml, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file.

param_list_format.description: Manually specify the param_list_format. Must be one of 'csv', 'json', 'yaml', 'yaml_blob', 'asis' or 'none'.
